intro: Grammosciadium pterocarpum subsp. longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed grammosciadium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and trifoliate leaves with elliptical leaflets. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in racemose inflorescences, followed by elongated, pod-like fruits. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
